page.title: 15A Farm Workers Day,Brenchley
page.content: Peter{lives and works on a farm which is part of a large estate.He is especially busy at hop picking time. The day starts at{4am}when Peter gets up.He works from{4.30am to 6.30am baling the hops dried the day before, then it's out to the hop gardens to spend the day cutting hops by hand and loading them into trailers.Peter supervises the casual labour brought in at this busy time and cuts hops himself until{5pm. Agricultural pay is low,overtime helps increase the weekly wage packet. After his day in the hop garden Peter returns to the farm to work a further 2 hours overtime till{7pm}clearing and tidying the hop shed and hop stripping machine or helping the engineer if repairs are necessary. Back home Peter is able to relax after a{long,hard day.
